website_summaries.verdict: If you can find the MSI GeForce GTX 1080 Gaming X 8G, it's a powerful high-end video card that makes full use of all of Nvidia's latest graphics technologies.
pros: Attractive lighting with many customization options
cons: Not the fastest card on the market

customer_reviews.title: Added a liquid cooler and it runs very cool
customer_reviews.text: I voided the waranty by adding a liquid cooler to this GPU (Armor OC) and its the bomb. I used a NZXT G12 bracket and a Corsair h75 liquid cooler and this card under full load OCed runs at 52C at the top (This voids the warranty, as a heads up). Under medium load it stays around 48C. Since this card is on the lower price end of GTX1080s right now, if you are thinking of liquid cooling it, its totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cabezon

customer_reviews.title: Decent GPU for 4k
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I didn't want to spend $700+ on a 1080 Ti. I honestly expected to have to turn some settings down, but I was surprised to find that this GPU so far is capable of playable frame rates at max settings for 4k in all the games I've tested so far. Witcher 3 maintains greater than 50fps, Fallout 4 stays above 50, and even with the fans spun up this GPU isn't all that loud in my Phanteks P400S.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card!
customer_reviews.text: This card is such an upgrade from the 970. I am still gaming at 1080P because I prefer the higher refresh rate to resolution. I am easily maxing out FPS on every game I have which I cap at 150 for my 144hz refresh monitor. Great card.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Murby

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these!
customer_reviews.text: They are real cards with good results in most of the stuff I do with it. Yet, compatibility issues occurred so often with so many things that really bothers me, and prevented me from doing so many things. I have got problems with Adobe Pr and Br, MSI mother board softwares, Corsair fan/RGB light controls, Assassin’s Creed Origin and Odyssey, Heart of Iron III and IV, Civilization IV, V and VI, and so many more. When I switched to the premium version of their MSI GTX 1080 cards or the premium kind of ASUS ROG GTX 1080, all the compatibility issues were gone, so I am sure it was this card.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Wang

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing card, can run everything on ultra maxing out ...
customer_reviews.text: So the original card that came in had a crack or some defect in one of the fitting threads. Amazon promptly answered my return request and got me a new card in just a few days. This is an amazing card, can run everything on ultra maxing out temps under full load (50degC). Can't say enough good things about the see through water block, very cool design don't see a need to upgrade a new card for a long time
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M Boney

customer_reviews.title: What they say is true - this was a relatively huge upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: It's a 1080 under water; it's fast, it runs cool, and works even better when you bridge it with another! That being said.... I upgraded from Tri-SLI GTX 780s (3GB); running on 3440x1440... So going to just a single 1080 is a huge upgrade. For me, it's a huge difference. So, if you're in similar shoes and looking to upgrade, the 1080 is an incredibly solid choice; especially if they're on sale, with the TIs being released! I Have a very hard time imagining anyone being disappointed if you're existing cards are a couple generations back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: but decided that this was the best performance-per-dollar option Haven't needed to overclock
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1440P monitor at 75Hz refresh rate and all of my games meet that potential on max settings Debated this and the "Ti" version, but decided that this was the best performance-per-dollar option Haven't needed to overclock, and I feel like this will carry my gaming rig at least five years into the future
customer_reviews.author: D J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Card. Shop around for price but this card is definitely worth  it!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never been the kind of guy who would pay as much as a GPU and I could build the rest of the computer for. I started with a Gigabyte AMD Radeon R9 290 4 GB but I founf out after the fact about the the last 500 MB of CPU memory was slower. Anyway, I usually go for that sweet spot between performance and value which usually falls around the $250-$300 mark. This time the allure was just too strong with the 8 GB Micron memory and the fact that this card would last a good two years (at least) before I had to replace it. It's a wonderful card. I run everything at 2560 by 1440.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Adams

customer_reviews.title: Nom nom nom graphics!!!
customer_reviews.text: This GPU is great, if your on the fence about upgrading to the current generation of NVIDIA just do it. Prices will inevitably go down but this is an absolute warlock. I can't attest to other manufacturers cards but I went with this same MSI card in the 1070 variant, it was also great, however I wanted a single gpu solution for 4k gaming. This was the ticket. I played about 6 hours of Mass Effect Andromeda in 4k on ultra and this didn't skip a beat. 60fps or better about 95 percent of my time playing on a 60hz 4k tv and its epic, beautiful, and the card was silent even at full speed. Love love love it
customer_reviews.author: Gordon R. Evans II

customer_reviews.title: Cooling is better than I thought so definitely will be OC with ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the first triple fan video card I own but will use this mainly for VR (HTC VIVE PRO). The card works really well out of the box. Noise level is a bit louder than the Twin Frozr model but it was expected since it has 3 fans. Cooling is better than I thought so definitely will be OC with Afterburner software to give it a bit more juice. The only thing that I think that need to improve is their mystic light software but other than that, everything working fine out of the box. If you are looking for a good 1080 out of the box with playing with OC, then this is a good choice!
customer_reviews.author: Only Three Cents

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gpu
customer_reviews.text: I was going to get a Vega 64 but they were all over priced and hard to get. I got this gpu on Amazon Warehouse for $420.00, I couldn't pass up on that. I have an LG 4k monitor and this gpu gets me a average fps of 60 or more on Doom, guild wars 2 I've got anywhere from 50-150, both games on ultra settings. Those are the only games I played since I got my threadripper build put together. Temps stay cool at 35c under load. Will buy another
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: The triple coolers does keep it cool and maximum i've seen hit almost 75C but thats ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy moly this card is massive. Built this on a no budget build and its freakin fast. The duke, as its name suggests, is a presence. I'm not even going to talk about performance because if you're looking at a 1080, you know what you're buying. It'll run VR, AAA games, and more without issues or hiccups. I have this connected to a 2K g-sync monitor and its able to push 100+hz without issues. The triple coolers does keep it cool and maximum i've seen hit almost 75C but thats cuz i'm powering 2K. Style is a little bland though but if you want a descrete looking 1080, this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Tang

customer_reviews.title: Top tier card, at a great price (when sold at its msrp)
customer_reviews.text: Top notch cooling in a dual slot design. Somehow even running at full load msi has managed to keep the hot beast of the 1080 whisper quiet. The multi layer design makes the whole thing super rigid, (unlike the armor cards) and do a great job of keeping everything cool and making overclocking as way as you can get. The build quality and performance make this card an easy recommendation from me
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: This card is worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Amazing card. Completely obliterates my former two 3gb r9 280x cards while using LESS power. Almost 2k core clock speed with 5k memory clock speed under load. Temperature stays well within 50 to 62 Celsius even after several hours worth of high demand gaming. Runs Battlefield 1 on all Ultra settings at 1080p 144hz almost flawlessly, even with my current i5- 4670k CPU and 8gb of RAM. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this expecting to get exactly what I purchased. What I got was an old AMD card with a GTX 1080 cover on it. Make sure you have two power cords, mine only had one. Completely bait and switch, counterfeit.
customer_reviews.author: R. B. Klock

customer_reviews.title: GTX 1080 Sea Hawk EK X
customer_reviews.text: Amazing card! Using MSI's gaming app in OC mode, the card automatically hits 1988-1999 MHz. Outstanding framerates on all games I play, in highest settings at 1080p. Runs very cool for the power you get, never had it above 46 or 48c at 100% load for extended periods of time. No choppiness, studdering or frame tearing. Best part is the waterblock was already installed and ready to go. Now if Nvidia could get their SLI to work properly, Id grab a second one of these and have some more fun.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Burke

customer_reviews.title: benchmark with FF14 hit a whopping 12k score on max setting on FHD monitor.
customer_reviews.text: As claim the package arrvied property boxed by MSI. When purchase please do check your pcie slot clearance. As the GPU comes with a rigid frame, it does take more space near the pci bracket (bracket near locking region) some machine with pci slot covering hood might find it in a tight spot. LED in the GPU can't be turn off. Gaming App from MSI didn't detect the presences of LED and function is notbexposed to user. Otherwise this is. Great GPU, a benchmark with FF14 hit a whopping 12k score on max setting on FHD monitor.
customer_reviews.author: scht

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU
customer_reviews.text: I really did not expect so much from the ARMOR edition, but for its low cost I bought it, to my surprise the factory OC reaches 1911 Mhz, without much problem I could increase it to 2048 Mhz / 5500 Mhz. It is extremely quiet, and neither with the OC that I comment came to use 100% of the fan. In FHD resolutions smoothly reaches the 144FPS in Rainbow Six Siege, 90 FPS in The Witcher 3, 60FPS Wildlands, all in ULTRA. I use it with a Lenoveo Y27G RE and it goes great.
customer_reviews.author: Ronpy

customer_reviews.title: Very cool improvement over GTX960!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for Red Dead 2 and wasn't disappointed for the most part. But the software drivers have been spotty at times and confusing with some game-specific. Also the new game drivers sometimes messed up old games (e.g. Skyrim) though for the most part the issues have been minor annoyances.
customer_reviews.author: Gary AZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for gaming and looks absolutely spectacular!
customer_reviews.text: Great for gaming and gives higher speeds to computers than many of the average graphics units out there (of course this is the 1080 we are talking about). Well worth the cost for high performance. Card can be a bit of a pain to put into mid-towers however and does have some weight to it. With two fans though, runs silent and cool. The LED's look absolutely wonderful and give a nice red glow. An absolute marvel to look at during operation.
customer_reviews.author: Tejay Hill

customer_reviews.title: I've had one of these for a while and recently ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had one of these for a while and recently bought a second to use in SLI. These things are absolute beasts. They run everything I throw at them in 4K 60FPS. I've tested The Witcher 3 modded, Ryse, Skyrim SE modded (using Dark Souls II SLI bits), Crysis 3, and Rise of the Tomb Raider. Benchmark scores I got in 3DMark were as follows for SLI: Firestrike Extreme - 16555 Firestrike Ultra - 9413 Time Spy - 11669 And for single GPU: Firestrike Extreme - 10117 Did not run Firestrike Ultra Time Spy - 7129
customer_reviews.author: Aether

customer_reviews.title: My First High End GPU
customer_reviews.text: When I got into PC gaming years ago I was still rocking a 560Ti when the 970 was out. After a few years and some saving I decided to finally build my dream PC. This card pretty much meets all demands you give it! I was really amazed by the temps when paired with 1 360 XSPC radiator. My temps have yet to hit higher than 40c. I have stressed it for 2 hours and saw no change. Even with playing BF1 for 6 hours non stop my temps were minimal.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Great VR rig GPU card
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my home built Oculus Rift VR system. Handles pretty much anything from this first generation of VR hardware well - including Elite Dangerous (ED). I am really upset that the cryptocurrency mining has kept prices high and is wasting MW of power to essentially accomplish nothing of real value. Hopefully that will end. Anyway, this MSI card (and all MSI hardware) is great.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Runs warmer than other 1080 cards out there, but still excellent performance for the money
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a RX580 to this and even though the card runs a little hotter than other 1080 cards, it's great performance for the money. To keep the temps down, just use MSI Afterburner and adjust the fan curve, other than that it's a great card overall and it's not noisy. My AIO pump is louder than the card which is nice :). Very satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a GTX 960 and the performance jump is amazing. It's surprisingly quiet (It's completely inaudible if you wear headphones anyway) and stays at decent temps. It can go up to 80c under load especially if you're playing on 144hz+ but that can easily be fixed by a custom fan curve. Overall this card is honestly a 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Denzel G

customer_reviews.title: Novice dads read this
customer_reviews.text: Awesome card. My kid is an avid gamer I'm not. He just cares about reliability and GAME performance. I'm sure all the cards out there would perform just as well. However, I had to use the Warranty on a previous MSI card. Their customer service was very efficient. Loyal customer until they prove different.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great for a blower style
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant about buying a blower card after reading a lot of negative reviews but now that I have one, I would definitely purchase another one if I am looking to save money or space. Basically runs just like any other 1080, plus it's cheaper and smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Its fast.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have it hooked up to a 4k monitor yet, I suspect that will be the real test. In its spare time it crunches looking for prime numbers, and it truly excels at that. No comparison to the 290x it replaced. Smaller, faster, cooler, quieter. It is in a Cooler Master Elite 130 with a push/pull fan set up on a radiator. The 290x had some interference with the pull fan, the 1080 has none.
customer_reviews.author: van z

customer_reviews.title: ... solution that stay silent while keeping the GPU at excellent temperatures. Even under full load
customer_reviews.text: MSI's Gaming X series cards have the Twin Frozr cooling solution that stay silent while keeping the GPU at excellent temperatures. Even under full load, the fans are reasonably silent. The GTX 1080 pretty much dominated any game I threw at it on ultra settings at 1440p. If you own a 4K screen, until the GTX 1080 ti becomes available for consumer purchase, this is likely the best solution to drive your high resolution monitor. Although I need to return mine for a defect, I've purchased MSI cards in the past and feel this is just bad luck and not indicative of the brand or the quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: gaming hell yes. noise. is that ever good? easy to install.....look at thepicture lol
customer_reviews.text: its runs uhd almost max detail on every game you can think of. hard as nails to install even with my giant NZXT h500 case this thing is huge. but its worth it if your got a i7 or overclockable i5 4th and above - id say - and triple channeling your ram. gddr5x also helps with heavy texture streaming.
customer_reviews.author: kryptodragon

customer_reviews.title: Maxed out 4K gaming is not a guarantee
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of great reviews of this card, so I won't rehash the obvious. However, do be aware that even with this beast, there will still be games where you can't max all settings running at full 4K resolution and still get 60 fps. This is not a problem for me, but if this is an issue for you, wait for the a GTX 1080 Ti version of the card, or the next generation of GPU.
customer_reviews.author: Robert and JoEllen Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Performs great. Stays cool. All max settings on ultrawide.
customer_reviews.text: I play everything on a PG348Q Ultrawide monitor at 3440x1440p resolution on max graphics at 100fps: Witcher 3, Battlefield 1, Civilization 6, Overwatch, everything. Card is flawless. Looks great in my InWin 509 case. I used EKWB blood red ekoolant. I've stress tested this and on a 360 radiator temps remained low. The waterblock is definitely top notch. For the price, you can't beat the time saved from doing your own waterblock installation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: very good card you can play 4k gaming if you reduice ...
customer_reviews.text: very good card you can play 4k gaming if you reduice some setting i love it make sure to stay on the last driver from nvidia and up date the dirict x iam on windows 10 46bit you can play mostly evry game make sure you have fans on pc case
customer_reviews.author: hussamaldine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Card - Great Results!
customer_reviews.text: This card looks very impressive when you pull it out of the box, but it didn't take up as much space as I thought it might. It has been fast, quiet, and cool, for the 5 months I've been using it. I frequently use it in games such as Arma 3, Star Citizen, Ark: Survival Evolved, Watchdogs 2, and several first-person shooters. I keep my graphics on the highest settings possible and in 1080p my framerate usually stays up in the mid 50s. I highly recommend this card. It has provided me with superb performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan L

customer_reviews.title: One of the cheaper GTX 1080 cards with overall pretty positive reviews
customer_reviews.text: One of the cheaper GTX 1080 cards with overall pretty positive reviews. Good -minimal RGB/white and black card -can run any game without a hitch -MSI afterburner works really well Bad -large card so make sure your case fits -can get pretty loud -Mystic light software isn't the greatest and took me awhile to figure out use it
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bang for buck (regardless of market being what it is)
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Has the ability to out preform some of the 11g cards I have been looking into. While I only just recently installed this in my PC (installation was very straight forward with instructions for those worried about it) and for the money I am pleased with the performance. Will update in a few months but loving the look and style just getting into it.
customer_reviews.author: Witty

customer_reviews.title: Definately recomended.
customer_reviews.text: It really is the top of the line & was not that hard to install. It has renewed my older PC (with a bit more RAM) & my graphics are smooth & impressive. It is all I had hoped it would be & more than I had expected. Didn't need or like the aps it included so I didn't install them. They were for newer games that I do not plan to play.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: used for my first build
customer_reviews.text: works good, everything looks amazing. the card sags a little bit on the side opposite from the brackets but this seems common among most CPUs so ill just be generally annoyed with that fact and not this individual product. seems to cool itself fairly well im running overwatch at 250-300 fps on low quality and the temp read 57-60 Celsius on average
customer_reviews.author: Erick

customer_reviews.title: Never had Thermal paste installed on it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2016 for VR use. Plugged in, worked fine at first, and with watching temps, it was running at the ragged edge of 80C from day one. Checked forums, everyone said that is what happens with a Founders card. Performance has over time seems to dropped, using benchmarks it has kept going down. About a week ago, I opened it up to replace the thermal paste and discovered it never had thermal paste on it. Put thermal paste on it, and now it runs at 55-60C, but it seems that these years of it baking itself has killed it over that time.
customer_reviews.author: Malic

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, stays cool, and keeps on pushing!
customer_reviews.text: So far it has been working wonderfully, I have been with an AMD build with a 280x. But constant problems and a dying card made me decide to put some hard money down on a top notch card. MSI's cooling is wonderful and keeps my card cool running the BF1 beta and everything else I throw at it. If you can, wait for the price to stick to the $749 range. You won't be disappointed. Playing Star Citizen with a steady framerate is a wonder to behold.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome video card. Handles everything I throw at it without breaking a sweat. Bought this same card for a rig I built my son and another coworkers VR setup. He uses for the Oculus Rift VR and he absolutely loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Best, so far.
customer_reviews.text: Really good cards all around. Runs nice and cool even under full load, easy to install (obviously) drivers are decent. (Geforce Experience or whatever is awful though, uninstalling it is best.) They're a bit shorter than the 290x I replaced. Very good performance in everything I've tried.
customer_reviews.author: Pirate_Joke

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable card.  Top performance with virtually silent fans.
customer_reviews.text: I's a ridiculous beast of a card which runs everything I've ever played at more than double the framerates with the quality forced higher than the highest settings. Even at the highest overclocks this thing is silent. I've never been as satisfied with a graphics card and I've been buying them since the first Voodoo chips. Great job guys.
customer_reviews.author: BestBeardedDad

customer_reviews.title: Great card so far
customer_reviews.text: So far the card is performing well. Cant play games on max settings and get 60fps but you can get close. If you lower a few settings you can maintain 60fps. Card is quiet and running cool
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer90

customer_reviews.title: Massive FPS improvement, must-have for MHW!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting terrible frames in MHW and couldn't keep up with my friends' leveling until I got this card! I went from ~30 frames to ~60! In PUBG, the game feels MUCH smoother as well. A massive improvement over my previous 970. I've been using MSI for my graphics cards and motherboard for years, and they still haven't let me down with their tech and performance. Great and fast customer support too! While the 2070 and 2080 have been announced, the price point of this card is about on par with the 2070, and still has a higher clock speed (the most critical spec of a graphics card). With the rebate, it was an easy decision!
customer_reviews.author: History Geek

customer_reviews.title: Bigger is better?
customer_reviews.text: Just received the card and it’s much larger than my GTX 960 or GTX 1070, so be sure your case has plenty of room. It is tall and long. Card takes 6pin + 4pin power. Overall great performance and overpowered for only 1080p. Packaging was nice and it’s a high quality card
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Clark

customer_reviews.title: Does what you expect a 1080 to do and fits in Node 202 just fune
customer_reviews.text: Great graphics card in our VR build. You should know what to expect from this video card by now.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Pritchard

customer_reviews.title: A big bite out of your wallet but worth it...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card to replace my GTX 950 FTW edition and this card is a monster compared to the 950. I've played every game in my steam library at max out setting, at 1080p and 1440p with little to no issues. Some of the games I've tested at max settings are Totalwar Warhammer, The Witcher 3, GTA 5, Fallout 4, Doom, and more. This card is worth every penny of your money, so if you have the cash, buy it. Will buy this card again.
customer_reviews.author: Tou Lee

customer_reviews.title: Video Rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace an older Geforce 760 and I immediately saw improvements. All games are running on Ultra settings and look fantastic. The only reason I put 4 out of 5 on the Tech Support is that I haven't had to bother calling them for anything.
customer_reviews.author: LonnieMitchell

customer_reviews.title: A great graphic card it runs games like Battlefield 1 at ...
customer_reviews.text: A great graphic card it runs games like Battlefield 1 at a great framerate in ultra, the only issue i had Is the high working temperature, reaching 78 to 81 degrees, as i have seen in forums this is the normal temperature for this card, but it Is a great choice to upgrade having no money to buy an 1080 ti, i'm satisfied with this card.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: No backplate but I'm pretty pleased with the product now owning it for almost ...
customer_reviews.text: No backplate but I'm pretty pleased with the product now owning it for almost a year. Funny coil whine sound when I use benchmarks like Valley and it tends to be pretty loud. The card generally stays around 60-70 celcius under heavy load. Other than that great card for 1440p and easily overclockable
customer_reviews.author: Pappalote

customer_reviews.title: I only give 4 stars because Amazon marketing did not post the Rebate correctly and had terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: I found this item to work really well and my custom Star Wars build and have had no problems with it. I’m giving it 5 stars because it’s functional and did what was described. I used a I7 7700k and a GTX 1080 both overclocked with EK D5 pump. I only give 4 stars because Amazon marketing did not post the Rebate correctly and had terrible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob T.

customer_reviews.title: Great gpu
customer_reviews.text: This gpu is my new baby and I love it. Got it for $450 just after RTX announcement. $150 off original msrp i’ll take that anyday
customer_reviews.author: Ian Page

customer_reviews.title: Never had a bad experience with them
customer_reviews.text: Stays at 71 deg C at full load in a 25 deg C ambient room. Inaudible at full load (60% fan speed). +250 on core and +400 on memory clock with no voltage increase. MSI makes quality pc parts. Never had a bad experience with them.
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price that I've paid, I'm feeling good for buying it. It is a GTX 1080, no explanation needed. I did my research and decided to go with 1080 instead of 1080 TI for the cost/benefit. The leds are cool and it's quiet, even when you're using 100% of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Luiz Amaral

customer_reviews.title: Great GPU
customer_reviews.text: Worth the price. I can play every game I tried on Max settings. Photoshop and 3DS Max are more responsive as well! One thing I dont like is that it's drivers require Nvidia Control Panel, which is kinda incompatible with one of my screens. I dont know about it's durability yet, been 2 months since I got it. Will update when it breaks, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Lyrcaxis

customer_reviews.title: performance
customer_reviews.text: no real problems. has been running well for me for 2 years now. led feature is red, only the dragon and msi logo will change colors
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen Joseph

customer_reviews.title: water cooled card for nearly same price as air......simple
customer_reviews.text: love it i paid just over what it cost for air cooled card ....... got a kick but card with a 150+ water block already installed ... idk if i got lucky or these are binned mine overclocks easily to 2115 and runs happy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flawless GPU's, never had any issues over 3 months ...
customer_reviews.text: Flawless GPU's, never had any issues over 3 months now. Very large so be prepared for the size. I also have NVidia Founders Edition 1080's also and I prefer the MSI's personally.
customer_reviews.author: Roush RS2

customer_reviews.title: Personal Experience
customer_reviews.text: Great graphics card, able to play any game at 1080p at max settings. I got it to run my HTC VIVE and it does it with no problems whatsoever. The only negative thing I can say about it is the price is a bit expensive for a lot of people. Excited to buy a second one for my PC to run in SLI. 10/10 Definitely plan on buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Justice

customer_reviews.title: good buy
customer_reviews.text: I was actually expecting to find something wrong with it but it turns out the drivers causes a lot of strange rendering bugs. you can update the drivers and it solves most problems.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Meholick

customer_reviews.title: Everything on Ultra
customer_reviews.text: Great card and a measurable improvement from the founders edition cards. Does exactly what is advertised and runs nice and cool, and remarkably quiet. I removed one star because the software that MSI provide needs to be running all the time instead of being able to be run as a background process. Exit the app and all your settings (including RGB LED customization) are disabled. Minor complaint but when I spend over $700 I expect the quality of the software to match the quality of the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: John Askew

customer_reviews.title: I was contemplating purchasing a complete upgrade, but this ...
customer_reviews.text: I was contemplating purchasing a complete upgrade, but this card has proven wonders. My computer is quicker, running on 3 monitors. Visually it is incredible. The Amazon Prime Deal was well worth it as well. Just make sure you utilize one of the control programs such as MSI AFTERBURNER to prevent the Cards internal Fan from throttling. but that is nothing uncommon with today's high end cards.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Beast graphics card. Overclocked higher than expected and just ...
customer_reviews.text: Beast graphics card. Overclocked higher than expected and just performs well in all games i play.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Love this card! MSI has done it once again with their amazing fan frozr design, while making everything super easy to overclock and an amazing amount of power in such a great card. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: This is a good graphics card and just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is a good graphics card and just what I wanted. However, the price went up over $100 from one week to the next when I was planning my project, and that was very frustrating. Felt like the product maker or Amazon were taking advantage, and if I had more time to complete my project would have searched for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Great card! He is VERY happy
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my nephew's gaming desktop with this. Great card! He is VERY happy!
customer_reviews.author: Max W Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent games video card.
customer_reviews.text: Good video card, allows me to run games at highest settings with excellent frame rates, runs quiet and cool. Only down side is higher price but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: Best decision I ever made
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I have not used it to is fullest potential but i am very happy with my build. Plus the aesthetics works well with my rig.
customer_reviews.author: DAMIAN A DESILVA

customer_reviews.title: Fast, quiet, cost $1000000000000 j/k
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for a friend with a dying gtx 780, he has been nothing but impressed with the advanced processor, and how quiet the MSI version of The gtx 1080 has been.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: MSI Gaming GTX 1080
customer_reviews.text: This refurbished gtx 1080 works wonders. It is currently running laps around my 980ti and not even breaking a sweat. With the current GPU price hike I feel I got it at a decent enough of a price, and I would make this purchase again with how happy I am with the card. I will now enjoy max graphic settings with high fps on World of Tanks and have a card that is cool and silent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Product. I loved my 1080 so much
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Product. I loved my 1080 so much. I would definitely recommend this product to others and I have. It is very quiet and very powerful. The perfect graphic card. The red and black makes it look amazing as well.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Foong

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this card, the is the highest end card I've ever had. had to cut the frame of the pre-built i have to fit it in (a random piece of the frame that wasn't important) Although the fans get noisy when i play games. still, i can actually play all the games i own now.
customer_reviews.author: julian

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought to run with my new PC Build. I was coming from a Macbook Pro and this has provided the best graphics experience I've ever had. I think the 1080 has the best value if you are going to be using a high refresh rate monitor.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Plays almost every game at 1440p@60fps
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this card. I'm currently running dual 1440p monitors and this card will play every game in my library at 1440p@60fps or higher. Very quiet cooler that keeps the card well below Tj Max, even with a decent OC. Also, for those looking into Ethereum mining - it's not as good as an AMD 390x(~30MH/s ETH) as of this posting, but with a memory OC I'm getting 23-25MH/s ETH at epoch #131 and 650MH/s DCR with the Claymore dual miner.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this card, I had x2 970 ti before and I was always having issues with some games that didn't support SLI, now with one card that's no longer a problem, and when it come the brand, I always get with MSI on all my hardware products, you simply just can't go wrong with MSI
customer_reviews.author: jorge zayas

customer_reviews.title: Awesome card easy install good value.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome card easy install and back to normal pricing. Replaced a 1070 that went into an updated build. Another great MSI card. Also rebate from MSI went smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: PulpComic

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Just want the doctor order
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Just want the doctor order! always get MSI!!! is always the way to go, the item got here in time, the seller answered the questions, Graphics look amazing
customer_reviews.author: Edgar J. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing puts the Asus 1060 it replaced to shame, can't wait to play Destiny 2 with it. I am able to game smoothly in 4k at ultra settings on the handful of games I have thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Kohlhoff

customer_reviews.title: Like adding a corvette engine to your pc.
customer_reviews.text: Love this graphics card it's so fast I reach new heights with it when it comes to FPS!
customer_reviews.author: RyanLBS

customer_reviews.title: No issues
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this card for three years and it still works great. I game using mostly max settings @ 1440p. No issues with overheating or crashes.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Just slightly too big for the mATX build I wanted ...
customer_reviews.text: Just slightly too big for the mATX build I wanted to put it in, but can't fault the performance. Top of the line for 1080, hard to beat if you can justify the cost.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Hanes

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, great graphics, little noise, easy to install! Just know it's very large.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: “Like-new “ worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: As you can imagine. I was very Skeptical of purchasing a “like new” video card. But I have to say everything turned out great. Very fast shipping. Product was in immaculate condition. Is has been installed and bridged with an Identical card and is working perfectly. This was a very hard to find card to find. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good card for the cheaper price.
customer_reviews.text: Works a treat so far. Make sure your case fits it. No problems playing all games at 1440p with pretty much everything set to high. MSI software is good, but make sure you use their drivers because for some reason the generic nvidia drivers offer way reduced frame rates for me. Also runs pretty silently and the fans stop when not in use. Has made my PC 50% quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, awful Amazon package!
customer_reviews.text: No doubt, one of the best video cards of the year!!! Runs well, good and smart engineering design, high frequencies from the box! The only thing that prompted me to give 4 stars is fortunately has no relation to the MSI Company, but to Amazon itself. I got the card in a rather crumpled box. Furthermore, the card was without ANY packaging, at least in terms of how the good packaging should look like. I take this opportunity to remind Amazon, that I bough a pretty pricey (at least for me) item and I would like to get it in the appropriate package, as befits electronics product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Evgeny

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful video card! Easy to install, runs great! I can finally turn up the graphics to ultra on the games I like to play! The fans work, it isn't noisy, and I haven't overclocked it because there hasn't been a need just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lance D

customer_reviews.title: Great card
customer_reviews.text: Amazing and extremely reliable graphics card, you could try and go for a better card now but this is effective for the cost it is now. Recommend if you have the money
customer_reviews.author: Anthony claiborne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful Card.. Trust MSI my last 3 cards and for now; won't look elsewhere unless they change drastically.
customer_reviews.author: Richard B.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy to install and goes great with my MSI board. Great performance, on maxed settings.
customer_reviews.author: LilliesMom

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: Working well for me so far. And looks nice in the case
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Good card for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice blower set up. Mine runs at about 1900 without me touching it not going above 70
customer_reviews.author: James E. Poole

customer_reviews.title: Eh
customer_reviews.text: Now that Radeon cards are out (the new 5700xt’s) it basically makes this card terrible for the money, it’s a bit loud but does everything I wanted plus more. It WAS a good value and if prices drop it will be a great value
customer_reviews.author: IINo27II

customer_reviews.title: Made for best game experience
customer_reviews.text: Powerful videocard that allow to enjoy games with best performances and image quality. Also have very cool look so if you have opportunity to use case with windows do it. I satisfy with my purchase. Edit: Update after 6 months of use. No issue found. Continue work without problems
customer_reviews.author: Aleksey

customer_reviews.title: Cars fails immediately after warranty expiration.
customer_reviews.text: This product’s warranty expired 13 days ago. Today it failed. MSI has said there is no way to repair it, just have to buy a new one. Unreal. I’ll be going with a competitor for my new cards in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Max Davis

customer_reviews.title: Amazing graphics card for my new computer build
customer_reviews.text: Amazing graphics card for my new computer build! This thing is quiet. The only time you can even barely hear the fans is when I'm really taxing the computer/graphics card
customer_reviews.author: JLee321

customer_reviews.title: One of the best graphics cards to own!
customer_reviews.text: For the price that I had bought it at, this graphics card is outstanding in performance and I do not regret buying this. I've never had a problem with an MSI product and I stand behind them 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Donny

customer_reviews.title: Have a GeForce graphics card in my current computer setup ...
customer_reviews.text: Have a GeForce graphics card in my current computer setup. I trust that this will perform as well as my current card.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J

customer_reviews.title: Overclocking beast.
customer_reviews.text: This GPU can take some serious gaming, unfortunately the one I got had some graphical errors under long gaming sessions but I won't deduct from the score as it was running perfectly fine before that. Would still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Killer

customer_reviews.title: Two's Company!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with my first purchase of this graphics card that I bought a second one to bridge! On top of that, it just looks cool!!
customer_reviews.author: OC/1251

product_meta.title: MSI Gaming GeForce GTX 1080 8GB GDDR5X SLI DirectX 12 VR Ready Graphics Card (GTX 1080 GAMING X 8G)
product_meta.description: Style:GTX 1080 GAMING X 8GMSI GeForce GTX 1080 GAMING X 8G is the ultimate PC Gaming Platform. Get ready to game with NVIDIA's “Pascal” processor, the most advanced GPU ever created. Discover unprecedented performance, power efficiency, and next-generation gaming experiences. VR ready to ensure you get the right level of performance, image quality, and ensure your gaming experience is nothing short of amazing!
